Speaker: leon
Dialogue: Okay if I talk?

Speaker: leon
Dialogue: I kinda get nervous when I take tests.

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: Don't move.

Speaker: leon
Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: leon
Dialogue: Already had I.Q. test this year -- but I don't think I never had a...

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: Reaction time is a factor in this, so please pay attention.  Answer quickly as you can.

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: You're in a desert, walking along in the sand when all of a sudden you look down and see a...

Speaker: leon
Dialogue: What one?

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: leon
Dialogue: What desert?

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: Doesn't make any difference what desert -- it's completely hypothetical.

Speaker: leon
Dialogue: But how come I'd be there?

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: Maybe you're fed up, maybe you want to be by yourself -- who knows.  So you look down and see a tortoise.  It's crawling towards you...

Speaker: leon
Dialogue: A tortoise.  What's that?

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: Know what a turtle is?

Speaker: leon
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: Same thing.

Speaker: leon
Dialogue: I never seen a turtle.

Speaker: leon
Dialogue: But I understand what you mean.

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: You reach down and flip the tortoise over on its back, Leon.

Speaker: leon
Dialogue: You make these questions, Mr. Holden, or they write 'em down for you?

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: The tortoise lays on its back, its belly baking in the hot sun, beating its legs trying to turn itself over.  But it can't.  Not without your help.  But you're not helping.

Speaker: leon
Dialogue: Whatcha mean, I'm not helping?

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: I mean you're not helping! Why is that, Leon?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Contact.  This is Blade Runner One

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Blade Runner One, stand by please.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Deckard.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Yah, Gaff.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: You know where I been.  I been on vacation.

Speaker: gaff
Dialogue: Next time you go on vacation, do me a favor, let us know where it is.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: What's up?

Speaker: gaff
Dialogue: Holden got hit.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Bad?

Speaker: gaff
Dialogue: Severed spine.  You'd better get in here.  Bryant's waiting for you.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: I'll see you in a minute.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Six, huh?

Speaker: bryant
Dialogue: Five.  Three nights ago one of them managed to break into the Tyrell Corporation.  Killed two guards and got as far as the Genetic Sector before he got fried going through an electro- field.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: What was he after?

Speaker: bryant
Dialogue: There wasn't much left of him, so we can't be sure.  But bio- chemical data and morphology records of the Nexus-6 were reported missing.  Going on the possibility they might try to infiltrate we send Holden in to run Voight-Kampff tests on the new employees.  Guess he found himself one.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: You got a machine on it yet?

Speaker: bryant
Dialogue: We're using Esper -- a 231 -- that picked up Holden's alarm.  Its guess is that all five are in the city.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Where do we start?

Speaker: bryant
Dialogue: The Tyrell Corporation has a demo model.  Check it out on the Voight-Kampff.  There's a chance the Nexus-6 is beyond out ability to detect.  If that's the case, everybody's up shit creek.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: What was the cover on the one that got Holden?

Speaker: bryant
Dialogue: Industrial refuse.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Garbage man?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Did personnel have an address on him?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: I'll go take a look.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: announcer's voice
Dialogue: Choose from a variety of seventy nine different personality types. Each and every one a loyal trouble- free companion given to you upon your arrival absolutely free...

Speaker: announcer's voice
Dialogue: To use as personal body servant to tireless field hand -- the custom tailored humanoid robot, designed especially for your needs.

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: Did you get your precious 'things'?

Speaker: leon
Dialogue: Somebody was already there.

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: Police.

Speaker: leon
Dialogue: Just a man.

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: Police man.

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: Why don't you have a seat.

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: Enjoy the view.

Speaker: chew
Dialogue: Well, you're right.  This little honey has a couple of defective cones.

Speaker: chew
Dialogue: You're a regular perfectionist, Sebastian.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: It's gotta be right for my customer.

Speaker: chew
Dialogue: Your customer, eh?

Speaker: chew
Dialogue: You got a pocket-charger, boy?

Speaker: chew
Dialogue: Is that good enough for your customer?

Speaker: chew
Dialogue: How much is he paying you?

Speaker: chew
Dialogue: Well, when do you get paid?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Soon as I finish the job.

Speaker: chew
Dialogue: When might that be?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Day after tomorrow.

Speaker: chew
Dialogue: Oh!  Day after tomorrow.

Speaker: chew
Dialogue: The rich hate to pay, Sebastian. A guy like Tyrell keeps you waiting. Pay the little guy last.  You should charge twice as much.  It'll make him feel better.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Thanks, Mr. Chew.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Hey!  You forgot your...

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: How come you were in my truck?

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: I was tired and didn't have any place to go.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You can get back in if you want...

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Don't worry, I won't hurt you.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: What's your name?

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: Pris.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Mine's J.F. Sebastian.

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Oh!  Where do you want to go?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You want to go home?

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: I don't have one.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Where are your folks?

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: They left.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: What about friends?

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: I have some, but I have to find out where they are staying.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Well, where should I take you?

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: We scared each other pretty good didn't we?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: We sure did.

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: I'm hungry, J.F.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I've got stuff.  If you wanna go to my place?

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: I was hoping you'd say that.

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: This is Esper and I'm ready.  Go ahead please.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: You equipped for random questions?

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: Why, yes, of course.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: You start.

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: The five in question are third generation Nexus Sixes, constructed of skin-flesh culture, selected enogenic transfer conversion capable of self-perpetuating thought, para-physical abilities and developed for emigration program.  Are you with me?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: How do I stop one?

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: Unlike a five, they can sustain massive traumas to several parts of the body without debilitating another.  Sever a leg and it will perform quicker on the remaining leg than the fastest man can run,

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Okay, but...

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: I'm coming to that.  Vulnerable zone is the base of the skull, the occipital bone.  A direct hit is a positive retirement.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: You are in violation of traffic ordinance M-139 statutory freeway limit restricted by one-hundred and eighty kilometers.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Oh!

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: Whatcha doin'?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You scared me.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I'm working.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You look... better.

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: Just better.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Beautiful.

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: And you live in this building all by yourself?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Yeah, I live here pretty much alone right now...

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: No housing shortage around here... plenty of room for everybody.

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: How old are you?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Twenty.

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: What's your problem?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Methuselah Syndrome.

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: My glands.  They grow old too fast.

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: Is that why you're still here?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Yes.  I couldn't pass the test.

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: I like you just the way you are.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Ah, you get hold of your friends?

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: As a matter of fact I did.  They've got some work to do tonight, but they're gonna come tomorrow.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I can sleep on the couch.

Speaker: mouse
Dialogue: Don't let the bed bugs bite!

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: Nexus designated Leon:  incept date April 10th, 2015 -- to be used in military experiments to determine how hyper metabolism functions in deep space. Nexus designated Batty incept data April 10th, 2015, combat model, level of self-sufficiency, optimum.

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: Here's something you might find interesting.  They have been built to emulate the human in every way except in its emotional spectrum. However, after a period of time it is only logical that such a 'mechanism' would create its own emotional responses, hate, love, fear, anger, envy.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: I know all that.

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: What about a summary then.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: I think we're through for the night.

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: Mr. Deckard.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: Do you have something against science?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Not if it works.

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: And what in your estimation works?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: The umbrella.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: Hello, Mr. Deckard.  My name is Rachael.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: It seems your department doesn't believe out new unit is to the public benefit.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: A humanoid robot is like any other machine, it can be a benefit or a hazard.  If it's a benefit, it's not our problem.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: But because your department can't do an adequate job in detecting the miniscule number at large, it's a problem.  Correct, Mr. Deckard?

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: You like our owl?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: It's artificial?

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: Of course not.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: You're in a very unique position, Mr. Deckard.  You could affect the future of this entire organization according to how you work your little test.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: Are you apprehensive?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Why should I be?

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: For the responsibility of your power.  Being a police bureaucrat, you've got more than your share.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: You got it wrong, girl.  I work with the bureau not for them.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: My job isn't to detect malfunctioning andies, it's to eliminate them.  The more the better.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: Mr. Deckard.  Dr. Eldon Tyrell.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: How do you do, Mr. Deckard.  Please sit down.  Would you care for a cup of coffee?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: Black?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Please.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: Somehow, I didn't expect that the man who did the dirty work would be the man to do the technical work.  Here you are, Mr. Deckard.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: Is this to be an empathy test?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: Capillary dilation of the so-called blush response?  Plus fluctuation of the pupil, plus involuntary dilation of the iris?

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: May I ask a personal question?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Go ahead.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: Have you ever retired a human by mistake?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: But in your profession that is a risk.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Nothing is infallible, but so far the Voight-Kampff scale bas been foolproof.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: Like you said, Mr. Deckard, a machine can be a hazard.  The Voight-Kampff scale is a machine, isn't it?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: One that relies on human interpretation.  Where's the subject?

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: Sitting next to you.

Speaker: deckard's voice
Dialogue: Ready.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: Go ahead.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: You're given a calfskin wallet for your birthday.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: I wouldn't accept it.  Also, I'd report the person who gave it to me to the police.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: You have a little boy.  He shows you his butterfly collection, plus the killing jar.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: I'd take him to the doctor.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: You're watching T.V. and suddenly you notice a wasp crawling on your wrist.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: I'd kill it.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: In a magazine you come across a full-page photo of a nude girl.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: Is this testing whether I'm an android or a lesbian?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: You show the picture to your husband. He likes it and hangs it on the wall. The girl is lying on a bearskin rug.

Speaker: rachel
Dialogue: I wouldn't let him.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: I should be enough for him.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: You become pregnant by a man who runs off with your best friend, and you decide to get an abortion.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: I'd never get an abortion.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: That would be murder, Mr. Deckard.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: In your opinion.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: It would be my child.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Sounds like you speaks from experience.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Last question.  You're watching an old movie.  It shows a banquet in progress, the guests are enjoying raw oysters.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: Ugh.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: The entree consists of boiled dog stuffed with rice.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: The raw oysters are less acceptable to you than a dish of boiled dog.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Lights please.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: Well?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: If she is, the machine works.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: The machine works.  She is.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: How many questions did it take?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Thirteen.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: She didn't know?

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: Memory implant.  She was programmed. But I think she has transcended her conditioning.  I think she was beginning to suspect.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: How many questions does it usually take, Mr. Deckard?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Five, maybe six.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: You're going to have to be on your toes, my friend.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: It's a complex problem and we wouldn't want anything to happen to you.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: For the good of all, I recommend you take Rachael with you. Considering her uniqueness, I'm sure she could prove quite helpful.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: No thanks.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: And how is it one man will be able to cover so much ground?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Discreetly.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: All pertinent information is being fed into your departmental computer, an Esper 231 -- I believe -- and a photo over-lay packet is being produced.

Speaker: tyrell
Dialogue: Mr. Deckard, I think it would be wise to reconsider my offer.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: I work alone.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Let's keep our eyes on the road, Deckard.

Speaker: deckard's voice
Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Come on, stay with the machine.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: We're going to have to start the sequence again if you don't stay with me, Deckard.  Concentrate.

Speaker: deckard's voice
Dialogue: How do you know I'm not?

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: You're not responding to the stimulus.  I can see right here, I'm not getting a reading.

Speaker: deckard's voice
Dialogue: I'm tired of this.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Almost through.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: So how did I do?

Speaker: wheeler
Dialogue: Nerves of steel.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: No rust?

Speaker: wheeler
Dialogue: I didn't say that.  Your motivity rate checked out a little slower than last time.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Meaning?

Speaker: wheeler
Dialogue: Meaning you don't run as fast as you used to.

Speaker: wheeler
Dialogue: During the road test...

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: wheeler
Dialogue: Your mind kept wandering.  That bothered me.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Huh huh.

Speaker: wheeler
Dialogue: Considering the nature of your work, that could be unhealthy.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: True.

Speaker: wheeler
Dialogue: You got a birthday coming up.

Speaker: wheeler
Dialogue: But you haven't put in for emigration.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Nope.

Speaker: wheeler
Dialogue: You're going to be over the limit.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Listen, I could make you a long list of complaints about this fucken city but I still rather be here than up there.

Speaker: wheeler
Dialogue: What if you change your mind?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: They'll change the limit before I change my mind.

Speaker: wheeler
Dialogue: You sure?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Never been more sure of anything in my life.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Why didn't you go?

Speaker: wheeler
Dialogue: Too old.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: But if you could?

Speaker: wheeler
Dialogue: My job is here.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Me too.

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: What's going on down there?

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: He's not ready yet.

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: When?

Speaker: pris
Dialogue: Tomorrow, he says.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: Was that your dinner?

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  I called and found out you were on your way home.  These were already delivered to your department but I thought you should have copies as soon as possible.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: It's the Nexus information you wanted.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Is there anything else?

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: I know you think it complicates your work, but I'm here to help.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: I've already got more help than I need.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: I think you need more help than you've got.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: There's two reasons a man rejects help.  Either because he's so good at what he does he doesn't think he needs it, or he's so insecure he can't admit it.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Sounds like I'm an ass-hole either way, but the answer is still no.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: Two of us might be more effective than one.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: I work alone.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: No you don't.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: You use your equipment, don't you?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: So?

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: So, I'm a piece of equipment. Use me.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: That's okay, I'll get it...

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: Do I make you nervous?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: It's strange to suddenly realize that what you thought was your life is actually someone else's fabrication.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: I can imagine.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: Can you?  I couldn't.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: A part of me is glad.  I think I feel more.  I don't like who I was before.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: So why do you think they were after their records.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: They probably want to find out when they were made.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: I guess the date of your birth is important if you know you're not made to last.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: That's my number.  If you need me.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: You better get better locks -- if you want to keep me out.

Speaker: rachael
Dialogue: Good night.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Night.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: bryant
Dialogue: Bryant here.  Regarding the rundown you requested on job applicants, Esper's concluded that the only irregular category that Tyrell's got is the entertainment section.  You better get on it.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: I was just about to have my dinner.

Speaker: bryant
Dialogue: If you hurry you'll get back before it gets cold.  I got a spinner on your roof in five minutes.  Good luck.

Speaker: epser
Dialogue: Nexus designated Rachael is a prototype.  Created for in-house use by special mandate form the Scientific Development Regulatory Committee.  Will live conventional term -- no para-physical abilities.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: What is a conventional term?

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: Four years.  Which would make her termination date...

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Never mind.  Do they have that knowledge?

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: Longevity is classified.  No.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Okay, gimme a run-down on the three females.

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: Nexus designated Mary:  incept November 1 2017, domestic conditioning non competitive, trained for day care position.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Next.

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: Nexus designated Pris:  incept data December 13 2017, competitive, programmed to provide pleasure for long term spacers.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Number three.

Speaker: esper
Dialogue: Nexus designated Zhora:  incept June 13th 2017, athletic conditioning, highly competitive, special abilities in the entertainment field.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Fuck.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Taffey Lewis?

Speaker: taffey
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Can I come in?

Speaker: taffey
Dialogue: Excuse my niece there... She's studying for an exam.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: I'd like  you to take a look at these pictures.

Speaker: taffey
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: taffey
Dialogue: You see I lost my contacts a couple of days ago around here somewhere and my sight is a little... What am I supposed to be looking for?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Do you recognize any of them?

Speaker: taffey
Dialogue: This one looks familiar, but I don't know.  Naw.  There's one came in today looks a little like this one but...

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: What did she want?

Speaker: taffey
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: The girl that doesn't look like that girl.

Speaker: taffey
Dialogue: Nothing.  She wanted to know about suck night.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: What night?

Speaker: taffey
Dialogue: I didn't know if I wanted to handle her -- I already got a snake act.  But my partner goes down there to the Opera House on suck night to book the good ones.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: What's suck night?

Speaker: taffey
Dialogue: That's what we call in the trade, audition free-for- alls and most of it sucks. Bit I don't think that's her.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: You talking about the Opera House on the Main?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Book the good ones for where?

Speaker: taffey
Dialogue: Lots of places.  The tours, the clubs, the Silicone shows, private parties.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: What shows?

Speaker: taffey
Dialogue: Silicone Valley.  Lots of these science guys never leave that place.  We book two shows a month in there. Those big time techs and bio- guys might be real high zoners up here, but when it comes to the arts, they like it loud and lewd.

Speaker: announcer's voice
Dialogue: Let's hear it for the Hermano Brothers.

Speaker: announcer's voice
Dialogue: Next we're gonna see a little charmer who keeps her dancing partner in a basket!  She comes to us all the way from exotic Casablanca.  'Salome.'

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Excuse me, Miss Salome.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: I'd like to have a word with you if I could.

Speaker: salome
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: I'm with the American Federation of Variety Artists...

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Don't worry, I'm not here to make you join -- that's not my department.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: I'm an investigator for the Confidential Committee on Moral Abuses.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: There's been reports of management sexually abusing the artists in this place.

Speaker: salome
Dialogue: I don't know nothing about it.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: You haven't felt yourself to be exploited by the management in any way?

Speaker: salome
Dialogue: How do you mean 'exploited'?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Like to get this position.  Did you or were you asked to do anything lewd or unsavory or otherwise repulsive to your person?

Speaker: salome
Dialogue: Are you for real?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: Oh, yeah. You'd be surprised what goes on around here.  I'd like to check the dressing room if I could.

Speaker: salome
Dialogue: What the fuck for?

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: For holes.

Speaker: salome
Dialogue: I don't believe this.

Speaker: deckard
Dialogue: It that mother real?

Speaker: salome

Dialogue: Think!  We need a little resilience around here!

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: Where are those balls of yours?! Let's see a little bravery!

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: That was irrational of me -- not to mention unsportsmanlike.  Won't happen again.

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: I'll be down the hall when you're ready.

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: Where you going?

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: No cheating.  A promise is a promise.  I'll honor the handicapped, but we gotta play on the top floor.  You go get your laser gun now.  And I'll give you a few seconds before I come.

Dialogue: One!

Speaker: batty's voice
Dialogue: Two!

Speaker: batty's voice
Dialogue: No fair jumping through holes.  You might get hurt doing that!  THREE!

Dialogue: Five!

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: Six!

Speaker: batty's voice
Dialogue: Seven!

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: Oh, I wonder where he is.  Not in here, I don't think.  Eight!

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: Maybe here.  Doesn't sound like it.  Nine!

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: Ten!

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: One point for you.

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: Ho ho!  Try it again!

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: What's wrong?  Don't you like me? I'm what we've made!

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: What's wrong?  Aren't you a lover of Faster, Bigger and Better?!

Dialogue: It's time to die.

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: Ah!

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: That's for you.

Speaker: batty
Dialogue: Stick it in your ear and push. If that doesn't work, try the eye.

Dialogue: Believe me, it'll be better for you than what I'm about to do.

Dialogue: Well?
